alert.note: Alert for Dakota; Dixon (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Sioux Falls (Southeastern SD, Southwestern MN, and Northwestern IA)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 11 at 9:43AM CST by NWS Sioux Falls
info.description: ...RAPIDLY FALLING TEMPERATURES MAY RESULT IN ICY ROADS... A cold front has pushed through the region this morning, resulting in rapidly falling temperatures. While most locations have fallen into the teens to 20s, still have a few areas across northwest Iowa that are near or slightly above freezing. Northwesterly winds during this time also remain quite breezy, with gusts ranging from 40 to 50 mph. Given our recent rainfall, could see any wet roads quickly become ice-covered and slippery. In addition to this, can`t rule out the possibility of seeing brief reductions in visibility as gusty winds combine with lingering snow showers. Use caution while traveling this morning, and be prepared for changing driving conditions.
